meanings.sent1: After the fire destroyed the old building, they refounded it with stronger materials.
meanings.sent2: The organization refounded its mission to better serve the community.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally refounded the cake recipe, creating a delicious new dessert.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for art refounded her creativity, leading to beautiful masterpieces.
meanings.sent5: The teacher refounded the student council, inspiring students to make positive changes.

meanings.definition: To provide a new basis or foundation for
meanings.sent1: The new evidence refounded the case, leading to a different outcome.
meanings.sent2: The architect refounded the building plans to accommodate the new requirements.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected discovery refounded their beliefs about the ancient civilization.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness refounded their friendship on a stronger, more genuine level.
meanings.sent5: The innovative technology refounded the industry, revolutionizing the way things were done.

meanings.definition: To start or establish again, especially with a new purpose or structure
meanings.sent1: After the setback, they refounded their business with a fresh approach.
meanings.sent2: The team refounded their strategy to adapt to the changing market.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to refound their club with new rules and activities.
meanings.sent4: The artist refounded her style, creating a unique and captivating series of paintings.
meanings.sent5: The community refounded the annual event, making it more inclusive and engaging for everyone.
